page.title: 02HOUSING/POPULATION
page.content: Most of the working inhabitants are employed in the village, others in Spalding and several in Peterborough. Many of the families are well established having lived in the area for morw than ten years. In recent years new housing development has almost doubled the population. There are slightly more women than men living in the village with children forming a third of the population. The women prefer modern appliances such as automatic washing machines to twin-tubs and tend to shop in the nearby market town of Spalding using private vehicles, which most families posess; though more own pets than cars. Television is the chief leisure activity with gardening, visiting relatives and 'Bingo' also being popular.
